com.iha.emulator.server

Class Server

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.iha.emulator.server.Server
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.lang.Runnable

    public class Server
extends java.lang.Object
implements java.lang.Runnable
    Class providing logic of concurrent server. New Worker is given to every client that connects to EmulatorServer.
    Author:
    Filip Sutovsky

    • Method Detail

      • run

        public void run()
        Server opens socket on port and starts to listen for new clients. Every client, that connects, will be given new Worker to process request.
        Specified by:
        run in interface java.lang.Runnable

      • isRunning

        private boolean isRunning()
        Gets if server is running
        Returns:
        true if server is running, false otherwise

      • stop

        public void stop()
        Stops server from running and closes server socker

      • openServerSocket

        private void openServerSocket()
        Open socket on port, where will server listen for new requests

      • loadProperties

        public void loadProperties(java.lang.String file)
                    throws java.io.FileNotFoundException,
                           java.io.IOException
        Load properties from configuration file given as parameter
        Parameters:
        file - name of configuration file
        Throws:
        java.io.FileNotFoundException - cannot find given filename
        java.io.IOException - cannot open or read given file

      • init

        public void init()
          throws java.lang.NullPointerException,
                 java.lang.IllegalArgumentException,
                 java.lang.NumberFormatException
        Initializes server by setting needed runtime variables from loaded properties. Also creates default DatabaseInfo from properties.
        Throws:
        java.lang.NullPointerException - cannot find properties
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - wrong configuration file format, more information in exception message
        java.lang.NumberFormatException - cannot convert server port to Integer number

      • updateLoggerLevels

        private void updateLoggerLevels(java.lang.String levelString)
        Sets log4j2 logger level for application.
        Parameters:
        levelString - level as string

      • checkIfExists

        private boolean checkIfExists(java.lang.String filename)
        Checks, if file with given filename exists
        Parameters:
        filename - filename to be checked
        Returns:
        true if file exists, false otherwise
